result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony R Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (10 Days +), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Submit DNA sample.  6 month probation review.  May transfer probation to Dane Cty.  Review can be submitted in writing.  Must report to probation by noon on 5/18/15. 

6/2/15 CORRECTED**  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after two years, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full, and successful completion of probation.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant granted Huber privileges under rules and regulations of the Columbia County Jail, Huber to include work and treatment purposes, may serve sentence in Dane County, Good Time granted, sentence to commence forthwith
Consecutive to: any other sentence

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail/hoc on 6-16-16; unpaid court obligations of $518 and supervision fees of $655
from J.W. re: defendant
from P.H. re: defendant

1:34 P.M., Defendant Anthony R Brooks in court, in custody with attorney David Kennedy Anderson.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel has received revocation paperwork, Court sentences defendant to: 7 months jail w/Huber, Huber for work or treatment purposes, may serve sentence in Dane County, consecutive to any other sentence, Good Time granted, 91 days sentence credit, sentence to commence forthwith 2:12 P.M.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus for June 16, 2016
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

filed by defendant and Atty Raabe.

10:14 Defendant Anthony R Brooks in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead guilty.  Court found guilty.  Recommendations for sentencing by ADA Cross and Atty Raabe.  Judgment was entered.  Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Must report at noon today.  $518.00 costs.  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after two years, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full, and successful completion of probation.  No jail credit. 6 month probation review.  Defendant may transfer probation to Dane County.  6 month review may be in submitted in writing to court.  Must submit DNA sample.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List with Petition for Leave to file Additional Motions filed by  ADA Troy Cross
Discovery letter filed by  ADA Troy Cross
all prior bond conditions remain.  Bond has been modified to $150.00 cash.

Defendant Anthony R Brooks by video in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Riek gave statement.  State opposes motion to modify.  Court will modify to $150.00 cash bond.
